summary: SEAT BELTS PROBLEMS. WHEN THE CONSUME FIRST TEST DROVE THE VEHILCE, HE FELT AS THOUGH THE SEAT BELTS LOOSE AND DID PRESS AGAINST HIS CHEST, THE DEALER STATED THE SEAT BELTS ON A LUXURY VEHICLES WERE FOR MOORE COMFORT AND THAT THEY WERE OK.  BUT AS TIME WENT BY, AND OTHERS DROVE THE VEHICLE THEY TO FOUND THE SEAT BELTS WERE TOO LOOSE AND THEY PROBABLY WOULD NOT BE PROTECTED IN THE EVENT OF AN AGAINST. THE CONSUMER HAD PURCHASED AN EXTENDED WARRANTY AND WAS TOLD THE WARRANTY WOULD COVER ANY INTERIOR OR EXTERIOR DAMAGE TO THE VEHICLE. THE CONSUMER TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER AND WAS TOLD THE WARRANTLY HAD EXPIRED. THE CONSUMER WAS TOLD THE SEAT BELTS NEEDED TO BE REPALCED BECAUSE THEY NO LONGER RETRACTED. *JB  (1996 LEXUS 400)
